chapter.title: Configuring services and optimal settings in Service Operation Console (SOC)
chapter.para: This chapter provides information about customizing the SOC. The SOC configurations impact the operations that are available to users in FTCT.

important.para: Follow the procedures below only if you want to customize the default distribution.
SOC configurations can be downloaded from Configuration Manager as a .zip file. The service folder found in the archive contains .xml files that correspond to each item.
SOC configurations can also be uploaded, by using Configuration Manager.

Before updating a service in SOC, remove the service from EAC. Newly added or updated services must be activated in EAC, after adding or updating from SOC. For more information on using EAC, see Managing tenants and service subscription from Enterprise Admin Console (EAC)

section.title: Logging in to SOC
section.para:
Open Internet Explorer and log into the SOC as follows: SOC log in attributes
URL
http://mgdhost.mycompany.com:8001/soc
where:
mgdhost.mycompany.com is the address of a load balancer that fronts the cluster of Managed Servers or the host on which a Managed Server instance is installed.
8001 is the clear port.
User credentials
netopmgr/netopmgr1

step.para: Log in to SOC, as described in Logging in to SOC.
To configure a service, click Services tab.

Alternatively, click the
icon.
The Services page opens.
From the list, click an item from the HomePageButtons category, for example HPB_FTTXJOBHPB_FTC.
In the Edit Services window, click the name of the property you configure. The Value field is automatically filled with the current values of the property.

The following properties are customizable:
attachedWorkflow: If the value of the property is, for example, FTTX_JobCreate_WFFTC_JobCreate_WF, it represents the workflow that is run when the button is pressed.
buttonName: Represents the name of the button, for example FTTX JobJOB.
icon: Represents the path to the .png file that is used as icon for the button.
id: Represents the button identifier, used when configuring the field technician roles in Optimal Settings.
solution: Represents the solution to be used. Depending on the selected solution, different tests, buttons, and messages are available in FTCT. Accepted values are fttxftc or oaa.
In the example below, attachedWorkflow property is selected.
In the Values field, add the new values, separated by semicolons. In the example above, FTTX_JobCreate_WF has already been added.
Click Update Property to apply the new values.
Click Update Services to update the service.

procedure.title: To configure optimal settings in SOC

step.para: Log in to SOC, as described in Logging in to SOC.
To configure optimal settings, click Optimal Settings tab.

Alternatively, click the
icon.
The Optimal Settings page opens.
Click the name of the setting you want to modify.
In the example below, ExpertFieldTechnician is selected.
The following properties are configurable:

listitem.para: DisplayJobList: Determines whether the job list is displayed for users with this role. Available values are yes or no.
JobButtons: A list of buttons, configured by following Configuring HomePage buttons, separated by commas.
Profile: Sets rows and columns as visible or hidden, by configuring the FieldTechnicians properties file. Currently used only by DSL ST.
Role: The role configured in WebLogic.
Services: The list of services to be displayed in FTC.

step.para:
To add a property, specify the following in the Properties tab:
Select a name for the property in the Name drop-down box.
Select a property type in the Type box.
Enter a value for the property
Click Add Property.
A property is created for the role.
After adding properties, click Update Optimal Setting in the bottom-right of the page..
The setting is updated and displayed in the Optimal Settings table.

note.para: For more information on using SOC, see SERVICE MANAGEMENT PLATFORM (SMP) Service Operations Console Help .

section.title: Understanding the relationship between SOC settings and FTC buttons
section.para: In the image below, the FTC buttons are configured by following Configuring HomePage buttons
The table below describes the association between the FTTX JOBDSL JOB button displayed in FTC and SOC HomePage buttons settings.

row.entry: FTC item
Description
SOC category

entry.para: The FTTx JOB button.
The button is defined in SOC by editing the HPB_FTTXJOB service and setting the value of the id property to fttxJobButton, as shown in FTC_HPB_FTTXJOB.png

The button is activated for a specific role by editing the role in the Optimal Settings tab in SOC. For example, it is activated for the Expert Field Technician role by adding the fttxJobButton value to the JobButtons property and updating the optimal setting, as shown in FTC_SOC_buttons_ExpertFieldTechnician.png
The Jobs drop-down list.

row.entry: The list is activated for a specific role by editing the role in the Optimal Settings tab in SOC. For example, it is activated for the Expert Field Technician role by setting the DisplayJobList property to yes and updating the optimal setting, as shown in FTC_SOC_buttons_ExpertFieldTechnician.png
FTC item

The button is defined in SOC by editing the HPB_DSLJOB service and setting the value of the id property to dslJobButton.

The button is activated for a specific role by editing the role in the Optimal Settings tab in SOC. For example, it is activated for the Expert Field Technician role by adding the dslJobButton value to the JobButtons property and updating the optimal setting.
